recipe_text: Measurement; 450; Measure out 450 grams of ground beef| Measurement; 150; Measure out 150 grams of onion, chopped| Measurement; 10; Measure out 10 grams of garlic, minced| Measurement; 400; Measure out 400 grams of tomato sauce| Measurement; 200; Measure out 200 grams of corn| Measurement; 100; Measure out 100 grams of black olives, sliced| Measurement; 15; Measure out 15 grams of chili powder| Measurement; 5; Measure out 5 grams of cumin| Measurement; 5; Measure out 5 grams of salt| Measurement; 2; Measure out 2 grams of black pepper| Measurement; 120; Measure out 120 grams of cornmeal| Measurement; 120; Measure out 120 grams of flour| Measurement; 10; Measure out 10 grams of sugar| Measurement; 10; Measure out 10 grams of baking powder| Measurement; 240; Measure out 240 grams of milk| Measurement; 50; Measure out 50 grams of egg| Measurement; 28; Measure out 28 grams of butter, melted| Untimed; None; Preheat oven to 200 degrees C (400 degrees F)| Untimed; None; In a skillet, cook ground beef, onion, and garlic over medium heat until beef is browned| Untimed; None; Add tomato sauce, corn, black olives, chili powder, cumin, salt, and black pepper| Untimed; None; Simmer the mixture for 5 minutes| Untimed; None; In a bowl, combine cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, milk, egg, and melted butter| Untimed; None; Spread the beef mixture in a baking dish| Untimed; None; Pour the cornmeal mixture over the beef mixture| Timed; 1800; Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes| Finish; None; Serve hot!
title: Hot Tamale Pie
